The patient presents with a combination of gait ataxia, bilateral appendicular ataxia (right-sided intention tremor/dysmetria and left-sided dysdiadochokinesia), and gaze-evoked nystagmus, which localises to the cerebellum. The history of 'worsening heartburn and acid taste' in the context of this neurological presentation is highly characteristic of Area Postrema Syndrome (intractable nausea/vomiting), localising to the dorsal medulla.
